intro: Vincetoxicum kawaroense, commonly known as the Kawaroe milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to animals and humans. Vincetoxicum kawaroense is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical forests.
